RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HARPERSGONEFISHING raced with the pace in the three path through the front stretch then stalked into the first turn, challenged leaving the three eighths pole and took the lead two deep at the quarter, contested the edge through the turn and dug in under steady encouragement to earn the nod. DON'TCALLTOOEARLY settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, dug in gamely to the wire but missed in a head bobbing finish. COMEONTURNMELOOSE settled off the rail on the opening turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and finished evenly to take third later yards. GOLDEN ARROW rated a slim lead off the rail, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met at the quarter and contested at a close disadvantage nearest the rail through the far turn, then weakened the final sixteenth. HE'S CLEVER broke awkwardly but took a brief early lead, stalked into the first turn then faded through the backstretch. TOTHETRAINSTATION rounded the first turn in the four path and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Don'tcalltooearly
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,off rail turn,game effort,missed nod

ENTRY.NAME: Comeonturnmeloose
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 7/16,3p far turn,even finish,up 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Harpersgonefishing
ENTRY.OWNER: Hasty Rebel Stables LLC and Carlisle Horse Company

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DALLAS angled to the rail into the first turn and settled well off the pace, started a bid leaving the half mile pole and steadily progressed from that point, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths and dug in to take over the final yards. KATALIMA rated close off the rail the first turn, took the lead at the three eighths pole and kept the advantage off the rail through the far turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was caught flattening stride the final yards. TIZBIT set the early pace inside, was met approaching the nine sixteenths pole and remained close from that point, challenged nearing the three eighths and raced close near the rail on the far turn, but dropped back into the lane and flattened the final sixteenth. BOCA BIRDIE raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and finished evenly to pass rivals. TAPPING SOUTH saved early ground, showed little response through the backstretch, rounded the far turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. VICTORY ROYALE stalked the pace two deep, took a brief lead at the nine sixteenths pole but was caught approaching the three eighths and faded on the far turn. CHANNEL SCENT leapt from the gate and was checked at the rail off the heels of Dallas into the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. The Stewards reviewed then dismissed a claim of foul against the rider of Katalima for alleged interference in the vicinity of the quarter pole, lodged by the rider of Tizbit.

ENTRY.NAME: Katalima
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,up 3/8,off rail turn,caught flattening late

ENTRY.NAME: Dallas
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in 5/8,well off pace,bid 1/2,3& 4p far turn,up final yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 102. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 36300. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since F ebruary 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 18 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOCIAL CHIC settled off the rail on the opening turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn in the three path, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and dueled clear through later yards. NICO rounded the first turn about the three path then stalked into the backstretch, challenged toward the three eighths pole and took the lead two deep at the quarter, but was met mid-stretch and relented later yards. JACKIE A raced well off the pace about the three path, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, eased out leaving the turn and came along for third late. DEBIT CARD raced with the pace and took the lead two deep into the backstretch, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met at the rail at the quarter, dropped back midway on the far turn and weakened in the stretch. DOWNTOWNCHALYBROWN set the early pace, was met into the backstretch and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, but weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Downtownchalybrown
ENTRY.COMMENT: slim early lead,met 1/2,chased 7/16,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Social Chic
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 7/16,3p far turn,up 1/16,dueled clear later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Jackie A
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 3p,chased 7/16,rail turn,eased out,along 3rd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 50. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowe d 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WOODSONG'S CASTLE chased toward the inside, entered the turn at the rail but angled to the seven path approaching the head of the lane, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn and got up the final strides. AWESOME MOON chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and dug in from the head of the lane, was outfinished in the final yards but kept the nod for second. REAL APPEAL gave chase, raced close off the rail on the turn, then outfinished in the duel through the stretch. A BLONDE THING chased the pace, raced in the three path on the turn, left the turn outside and finished well. VEGAS PRINCESS drew clear while angling to the inside, raced at the rail on the turn and kept the edge to later yards before flattening stride. I SHALLBE RELEASED gave chase inside, rounded the turn at the rail and ran evenly in the lane. MARLEESBEEBEE chased through the backstretch, raced close in the three path on the turn then flattened inside the eighth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Woodsong's Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,angled 7p 1/8,dug in lane,up final strdes

ENTRY.NAME: Vegas Princess
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,kept edge to late lane,flattened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 73. Allowance Purse 34900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners O f A Race At A Mile Or Over Since February 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since January 18 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROCK ROSE took over two deep at the mile pole and rated the pace, came under pressure past the three eighths, widened at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert through the stretch. HOW IS SHE raced well off the early pace toward the inside, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole and circled rivals in the five path on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and got up for second late. DAT DARES GOLD rated close off the rail, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was nipped from second late strides. PRACTICALLY THERE raced well off the pace saving early ground, eased out with a bid into the backstretch, rounded the far turn about the three path then flattened in the lane. ELIANAGRACE settled off the rail, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole but faded on the far turn. SAX raced off the pace inside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened. CREEDIBILITY became a bit edgy in the gate, came away rank and saved ground. LIKELY CHOICE had a brief lead inside then stalked from the mile pole, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths but faded off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Likely Choice
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief early lead inside,stalked 1m pole,chased 7/16,fade far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Practically There
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,eased out 1/2,chased,3p far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: How Is She
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace inside,bid 3/8,circled 5p far turn,up 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Rock Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured 3/8,widened rail turn,kept alert lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 36300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 18 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered Fo r $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ICING exchanged contact with Boss E Boggs leaving the gate, took the lead at the three quarter pole and rated a short lead off the rail, drew clear past the half mile pole, came under pressure toward the three eighths and held on with steady stretch handling. ONE NIGHT MIKE broke awkwardly then stalked inside, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn and finished evenly at the outside flank of the winner. PENGUIN PARADE raced off the pace about the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and flattened in the lane. REMYS SHOWTIME settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little more. BOSS E BOOGS exchanged contact with Icing then saved ground. STRINGFELLA saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Icing
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,up 3/4,rated pace,clear past 1/2,rail turn,held on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 68. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 18 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HAZEDNCONFUSED settled in the three path the first turn, bid leaving the half mile pole, took over three wide midway on the far turn and held well under steady stretch handling. GRUMPY'S BUDDY rated close to the early pace inside, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and finished well to clear second mid-stretch. MARCHED rated a short lead inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met at the rail midway on the far turn and flattened the final sixteenth. NEVERPOPTHECORK rated off the pace and off the rail on the opening turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole and raced close two deep while between horses on the far turn, though, flattened inside the eighth pole. CHIPPEWA'S CASTLE stalked two deep, gave chase from the three eighths pole but faded at the rail on the far turn. HILLBILLY ROCK rounded the opening turn about the four path and showed little response through the backstretch. S S ALASKAN CRUZ saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Chippewa's Castle
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 68. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 18 Allowed 4 lbs. (Race s Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BARBERS POINT rounded the first turn in the four path, challenged toward the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead two deep midway on the far turn, drifted leaving the turn but dug in under steady handling and held on well. NEAREST N DEAREST settled in the three and four paths the first turn, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole and drew close in the three path of the far turn, came inside the drifting winner at the eighth pole and dueled through the stretch for second. FRENCHIES GOLD became fractious in the gate, broke a step slow and steadied shortly after the start, rounded the first turn in the four path, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path of the far turn, finished well to take third later yards and was gaining on the runner-up. KEEP ON SPURRIN rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was met at the rail midway on the far turn and weakened inside the eighth pole. JUBA BABY settled off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and ran evenly in the lane. IHEARTRAINACOMN rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch but faded nearing the far turn. LUCKY BLONDE became fractious in the gate and saved ground. NEW AGE BAD GIRL became unruly behind the gate, saved ground off the pace, gave chase from the three eighths pole then weakened at the rail on the far turn. ELLIES AT WINDSOR rated close in the two and three paths the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Iheartrainacomn
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close insdie,chased 1/2,faded near far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Juba Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,bid 3/8,3p far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Frenchies Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious in gate,step slow,4p 1st turn,bid 7/16,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: New Age Bad Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Krishack Joanne P and Krishack Stephan E

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE SEPTEMBER 18, 2022. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4, 000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TEQUILA FOG rated close inside on the opening turn, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, took the lead two deep approaching the eighth pole and was kept alert through the lane. MAE SAI PRINCESS rounded the opening turn in the four path, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and dueled through the stretch for second. DUSTWHIRL WONDER rounded the first turn in the five path, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in range of the leader in the three path of the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. CHIT CHAT GIRL raced in the three and four paths on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, angled out into the lane and finished evenly. HURRICANE DIRECTOR took the lead three wide into the first turn and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, was met at the rail toward the head of the lane and weakened inside the eighth pole. HAD THE NOTION raced off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path but was shut off at the heels of Chit Chat Girl into the lane and weakened. ANNIKA GOLD rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. SO RED THE ROSE saved ground. SUPERSTASIA rounded the first turn in the three path and was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Annika Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Tequila Fog
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,bid 7/16,up 2d near 1/8,kept sharp lane
